page.title: 06EMPLOYMENT IN THE BARR AREA
page.content: 95% of the area is "highland" used mainly for sheep-there is relatively little employment.Those who are employed on the land are mainly shepherds.There is a high proportion of tenant farmers whose children usually have to leave the area to find employment. The village is a "dormitory village" with the people of working age travelling to Girvan or Ayr to their places of employment. The nearby Forestry Commission at Changue Forest employs a small percentage of the villagers. The two hotels provide employment for only four people.The store/post office employs four ladies(part-time). Strathclyde Regional Council employs the teachers,janitor and cook(in the school),the hallkeeper, roadman and water-works operator. The minister and doctor also "work" in the area.
